_metadata.context: Integrated Framework for Inquiry and Creation

concepts.name: Application
concepts.theory_application: Put the plan into action, translating abstract protocols into concrete behaviors and recording the results.

variations.theory: Definition: Application is the empirical act of putting the protocol into practice. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the empirical act of putting the experimental protocol into practice to gather data.
Definition: Application is executing the tasks defined in the sprint backlog. Procedural Link: The action is to execute the tasks defined in the sprint backlog to create a working software increment.
Definition: Application is the writing of the first draft or fieldwork. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the writing of the first draft or the gathering of data during fieldwork.
Definition: Application is the physical act of fabrication or rehearsal. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the physical act of fabricating the artwork or performing the rehearsal.
Definition: Application is the embodiment of the plan through mindful action. Procedural Link: The action is to embody the plan through mindful, ethical, and purposeful action.

concepts.name: Build
concepts.theory_application: Engage in the physical or digital construction of the product, system, or narrative.

variations.theory: Definition: Build is the construction of a new device or system. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the construction or assembly of a new device, lab apparatus, or functional system (e.g., a prototype). (N28)
Definition: Build is writing, testing, and integrating code. Procedural Link: The action is to write, test, and integrate the code to create the 'potentially shippable increment.'
variations.specific_deliverable: A Software Build for the ECU.

variations.theory: Definition: Build is the non-linear process of constructing a narrative. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the non-linear process of constructing a narrative or argument in prose.
Definition: Build is the physical process of construction or rendering. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the physical process of construction, sculpting, or digital rendering.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Clay Model of the body.

variations.theory: Definition: Build is the focused effort of building social trust. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the focused effort of building social trust or a new community resource.

concepts.name: Conduct
concepts.theory_application: Perform a specific task or ceremony according to a defined protocol or methodology.

variations.theory: Definition: Conduct is performing a task according to a formal protocol. Procedural Link: The action is to perform a research task according to a formal, established protocol (e.g., conducting a titration, a survey, or an interview).
Definition: Conduct is managing coordination and ceremonies. Procedural Link: The action is to manage the day-to-day coordination and ceremonies of the team (e.g., conducting a daily stand-up).

Definition: Conduct is performing fieldwork or archival research. Procedural Link: The action is to perform fieldwork (N29), archival research, or administering qualitative interviews according to a methodology.
Definition: Conduct is running a rehearsal or technical test. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in running a rehearsal (N30) or a technical performance test.
Definition: Conduct is performing a formal ceremony or ritual. Procedural Link: The action is to perform a formal ceremony or ritual (N88) with precision and integrity.

concepts.name: Create
concepts.theory_application: Bring something new into existence, whether it is data, code, text, art, or social value.

variations.theory: Definition: Create is bringing a new piece of data or knowledge into existence. Procedural Link: The action is to aim for the ultimate goal of the task: bringing a new piece of data, knowledge, device, or artistic form into existence.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Research Backgrounder for the setting.

variations.theory: Definition: Create is delivering a tangible, working increment. Procedural Link: The action is to deliver a tangible, working increment of software or a feature that can be shown to users.
Definition: Create is producing the first complete draft. Procedural Link: The action is to produce the first complete draft of the argument or theory.
Definition: Create is producing the final artwork or prototype. Procedural Link: The action is to produce the final artwork or an early, testable prototype.
Definition: Create is bringing a socially beneficial action into reality. Procedural Link: The action is to bring a socially beneficial action or community resource into reality.

concepts.name: Deeds
concepts.theory_application: Focus on the tangible, verifiable outcomes of action, recognizing the ethical dimension of what is done.

variations.theory: Definition: Deeds are the ethical dimension of action. Procedural Link: The action is to recognize the ethical dimension of action; the understanding that execution has real-world consequences that must be monitored.
Definition: Deeds are the tangible, verifiable outcomes. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the tangible, verifiable outcomes of the sprint execution.
Definition: Deeds are the tangible scholarly output. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the tangible scholarly output (e.g., the first draft, the completed interview transcripts).
Definition: Deeds are the physical marks left on the medium. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the physical marks left on the medium by the artist’s process (e.g., brushstrokes, weld marks).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Photo Documentation of the event.

variations.theory: Definition: Deeds are the concrete acts of service. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the concrete acts of service performed for the community.

concepts.name: Drafting
concepts.theory_application: Engage in the initial creation of a document, code, or artwork, focusing on getting ideas down rather than perfection.

variations.theory: Definition: Drafting is writing the first report or documentation. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in writing the first report, paper section, or technical documentation based on raw data.
Definition: Drafting is writing code and documentation. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the writing of code and associated documentation (e.g., API docs, user help text).
Definition: Drafting is composing the First Draft. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the intellectual work of composing the First Draft (N27) of the written argument or theoretical paper.
Definition: Drafting is the initial sketching or rendering. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the initial, low-fidelity sketching, rendering, or composing of the work's primary elements.
Definition: Drafting is writing a process journal. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the writing of a process journal (N31) to capture reflections and tacit knowledge.

concepts.name: Embodiment
concepts.theory_application: Translate abstract knowledge into physical form or action, engaging the body and senses to deepen understanding.

variations.theory: Definition: Embodiment is translating abstract knowledge into procedural knowledge. Procedural Link: The action is to translate abstract knowledge (the protocol) into procedural knowledge residing in the hands and mind of the experimenter.

Definition: Embodiment is technical translation into functional code. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the technical translation of the spec into functional, running code that is physically deployed on a server.

Definition: Embodiment is physical immersion in the field. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the researcher's physical immersion in the field (N29) to gain an intuitive, contextual understanding of the subjects.

Definition: Embodiment is the physical reality of the work. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the physical reality of the work, or the performer’s mastery of the technical skill set (muscle memory).
Definition: Embodiment is mindful action. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the Focused, Present-Moment Action (N164) that is a full expression of an internal value or principle.

concepts.name: Enactment
concepts.theory_application: Perform or execute a plan in real-time, bringing it to life and testing its viability in the real world.

variations.theory: Definition: Enactment is the performative reality of running the experiment. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the performative reality of running the experiment or operating the technical system.
Definition: Enactment is deploying a feature to a staging server. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the moment a feature is deployed to a staging server for internal testing.

Definition: Enactment is the act of writing or performing fieldwork. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the act of writing (N27) or performing fieldwork (N29), bringing the abstract plan to reality.
Definition: Enactment is the live performance or public rehearsal. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the live performance or public rehearsal of a piece.
Definition: Enactment is performing a relational ritual. Procedural Link: The action is to perform a relational ritual or ceremony in front of the community.

concepts.name: Execution
concepts.scenario: Rolling out a new IT system.
concepts.theory_application: Carry out the planned tasks with discipline, diligence, and attention to detail.

variations.theory: Definition: Execution is the disciplined and accurate carrying out of the structured plan. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the disciplined and accurate carrying out of the structured plan from Tool 5.
Definition: Execution is the diligent implementation of tasks. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the diligent implementation of the prioritized tasks in the sprint backlog.
Definition: Execution is methodical gathering and recording of data. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the methodical gathering and recording of data according to the research methodology.
Definition: Execution is the precise work of the craftsperson. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the precise work of the craftsperson or the controlled movement of the performer.
Definition: Execution is the conscious performance of ethical duties. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the conscious performance of ethical duties (Virtue) with full attention.

concepts.name: Experiment
concepts.theory_application: Conduct a controlled procedure to generate data, test a hypothesis, or validate an assumption.

variations.theory: Definition: Experiment is the formalized procedure to generate empirical data. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the formalized procedure designed to generate empirical data to test a hypothesis (N26).
variations.rubric: Engage in procedure to generate data.

variations.theory: Definition: Experiment is building an MVP to test an assumption. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in building a Minimal Viable Product (MVP) or prototype to test a core user assumption.
Definition: Experiment is an exploratory research step. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in an exploratory research step (e.g., conducting pilot interviews) to validate the methodology.

Definition: Experiment is a controlled study of material properties. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in a controlled study of material properties or a technical rehearsal of a design element.

variations.expert: M. M. Bakhtin - The Community Manager
variations.theory: Definition: Experiment is a small, safe-to-fail intervention. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in a small, safe-to-fail intervention in a community to test a new process.

concepts.name: Fabrication
concepts.scenario: Producing a limited run of furniture.
concepts.theory_application: Engage in the physical construction or assembly of components to create a finished object or system.

variations.theory: Definition: Fabrication is manufacturing or constructing physical components. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the act of manufacturing or constructing the physical components of the solution or the experimental apparatus.
Definition: Fabrication is building server infrastructure. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the building of the physical server infrastructure or the assembly of a hardware product.

Definition: Fabrication is collecting and organizing archival materials. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the physical process of collecting and organizing archival materials (e.g., scanning, transcribing).
Definition: Fabrication is making the final work. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the making of the final work in its physical medium (e.g., welding, carving, casting).

Definition: Fabrication is creating community infrastructure. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the physical creation of community-based infrastructure (e.g., a shared garden, a public space).

concepts.name: Fieldwork
concepts.theory_application: Gather data and observations in a naturalistic setting, outside the controlled environment of the laboratory or office.

variations.theory: Definition: Fieldwork is gathering data in a naturalistic setting. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the gathering of data in a naturalistic setting outside the controlled laboratory environment.
Definition: Fieldwork is conducting ethnographic research. Procedural Link: The action is to conduct ethnographic research or usability testing of the product in the user's natural habitat (N29).

Definition: Fieldwork is immersion within a community. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the immersion of the researcher within a community or archival site to gather raw, qualitative data (N29).
Definition: Fieldwork is creating a site-specific installation. Procedural Link: The action is to create a site-specific installation or performance in its final, intended environment.
Definition: Fieldwork is on-site observation. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in on-site observation and engagement with the community or ecosystem to gather relational context.

concepts.name: Flow State
concepts.theory_application: Design the work environment and task structure to facilitate a state of deep immersion, where challenge matches skill.

variations.theory: Definition: Flow is the optimal state where challenge matches skill, leading to deep immersion. Procedural Link: The action is to design the experimental task to have a clear balance of challenge and skill to maximize the researcher's focused immersion.

Definition: Flow is the optimal state where challenge matches skill. Procedural Link: The action is to eliminate distractions and ensure the task is clearly defined to allow the engineer to enter a state of deep, productive work.

Definition: Flow is the optimal state where challenge matches skill. Procedural Link: The action is to structure the writing session to have immediate feedback (e.g., word count goals) to sustain the writer's focused immersion.

Definition: Flow is the optimal state where challenge matches skill. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the artist must set clear, immediate goals for the session to ensure the challenge matches their skill level, enabling flow.

Definition: Flow is the optimal state where challenge matches skill. Procedural Link: The action is to design the ethical action to be challenging but achievable, allowing the individual to experience deep, mindful engagement.

concepts.name: Fulfillment
concepts.theory_application: Recognize and validate the successful completion of a task, project, or obligation.

variations.theory: Definition: Fulfillment is the successful completion of the protocol. Procedural Link: The action is to recognize the fulfillment as the successful completion of the experimental protocol or the build objective.

Definition: Fulfillment is the successful delivery of the sprint backlog. Procedural Link: The action is to recognize the fulfillment as the successful delivery of the agreed-upon tasks in the sprint backlog.

Definition: Fulfillment is the satisfactory completion of the first draft. Procedural Link: The action is to recognize the fulfillment as the satisfactory completion of the first draft or the planned data collection phase.

Definition: Fulfillment is the successful realization of the final concept. Procedural Link: The action is to recognize the fulfillment as the successful realization of the final concept in its physical form.

Definition: Fulfillment is the perceived completion of an obligation. Procedural Link: The action is to recognize the fulfillment as the perceived completion of a communal obligation or ethical pledge.

concepts.name: Guide: Coaching
concepts.theory_application: Support the development of another person through questioning, feedback, and guidance, rather than direct instruction.

variations.theory: Definition: Coaching involves reflection-in-action and minimal intervention. Procedural Link: The action is to guide the junior researcher by asking 'What if' questions that prompt them to reflect on their actions and self-correct.

Definition: Coaching involves reflection-in-action and minimal intervention. Procedural Link: The action is to help the team get unstuck by asking probing questions (the Coaching Loop Path) rather than providing the solution.

Definition: Coaching involves reflection-in-action and minimal intervention. Procedural Link: The action is to prompt a writer to articulate their tacit struggle during the drafting process to make the problem explicit and solvable.

Definition: The CRP gives the artist agency over the critique process. Procedural Link: The action is to offer minimal, precise feedback to a performer to help them realize their own intention, not the coach's.

Definition: Freire advocates for 'problem-posing' education. Procedural Link: The action is to guide a novice through a difficult social action by modeling humility and asking questions that build their critical awareness.
Teacher Talking Time (TTT). Procedural Link: Measure and minimize TTT to maximize Student Talking Time (STT).

concepts.name: Implementation
concepts.theory_application: Execute the specific technical tasks required to put a plan into effect.

variations.theory: Definition: Implementation is the specific technical work of deployment. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the specific technical work of coding, configuration, and deployment of the planned solution.

Definition: Implementation is the technical process of writing and deploying code. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the technical process of writing and deploying the code that realizes the agreed-upon features.

Definition: Implementation is the act of writing the core argument. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the act of writing the core argument into prose or executing a complex data analysis script.

Definition: Implementation is the detailed work of production. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the detailed work of production, such as assembling components or performing technical post-production.

Definition: Implementation is the specific, technical deployment of a safeguard. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the specific, technical deployment of a social or ethical safeguard (e.g., setting up a secure data system).

concepts.name: Kaizen
concepts.theory_application: Continuously improve processes through small, incremental changes to reduce waste and increase efficiency.

variations.theory: Definition: Kaizen is continuous, incremental improvement. Procedural Link: The action is to implement continuous, incremental improvement to experimental procedures and protocols based on daily observations.

Definition: Kaizen is continuous, incremental improvement. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the ongoing commitment to optimizing and reducing waste in the entire value stream of the business (Lean).
Definition: Kaizen is continuous, incremental improvement. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the continuous, small-scale refinement of writing style, argument clarity, or research habits.

Definition: Kaizen is continuous, incremental improvement. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the ongoing nurturing and refinement of craft mastery through deliberate practice and focused iteration.
Definition: Kaizen is continuous, incremental improvement. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the dedication to continuous improvement in social processes and ethical governance.

concepts.name: Focused, Present-Moment Action
concepts.theory_application: Perform tasks with full, conscious attention and intention, avoiding distraction and automaticity.

variations.theory: Definition: Mindful action is performing a task with full, focused attention. Procedural Link: The action is to perform the experimental protocol with full, focused attention and intention, not mindlessly.

Definition: Mindful action is performing a task with full, focused attention. Procedural Link: The action is to code or build with full attention, setting conscious triggers (N-CBT-5) to avoid multitasking or distractions.

Definition: Mindful action is performing a task with full, focused attention. Procedural Link: The action is to write or read with full concentration, noting personal emotional and cognitive responses (Process Journal - N31).
Definition: Mindful action is performing a task with full, focused attention. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the creation or performance with present moment awareness. (N164)
Definition: Mindful action is performing a task with full, focused attention. Procedural Link: The action is to perform an action with full presence and ethical intent (Karma Yoga). (N164)
Pair Programming. Procedural Link: Two people work on one workstation to improve quality and focus.

concepts.name: Practice
concepts.theory_application: Engage in deliberate, repetitive effort to improve skill and performance.

variations.theory: Definition: Deliberate Practice is focused effort to refine a technique. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the iterative, focused effort to refine a technique, experiment, or procedure to the point of mastery.

Definition: Practice is the regular effort of building and testing code. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the regular effort of building and testing code, often through deliberate, repetitive training sessions.
Definition: Practice is the dedicated routine of drafting and editing. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the dedicated, focused routine of drafting, editing, and fact-checking.

Definition: Deliberate Practice is focused effort to refine a technique. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the dedicated repetition of technical skills or performance routines (N30) to achieve mastery (Deliberate Practice - N165).
Definition: Practice is the disciplined engagement in dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the disciplined engagement in community dialogue or self-inquiry (N81).

concepts.name: Prototyping
concepts.theory_application: Create a preliminary model or version of a product to test concepts and gather feedback.

variations.theory: Definition: Prototyping is building a minimal test of a hypothesis. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in building a minimal, low-fidelity test of an experimental design or technical hypothesis. (N28)
Definition: Prototyping is building an MVP to test an assumption. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in building a Minimal Viable Product (MVP) or prototype to test a core user assumption.
Definition: Prototyping is creating a low-fidelity mock-up. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in creating a low-fidelity mock-up of an interactive or media-driven academic work.
Definition: Prototyping is creating a small-scale model. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in creating a small-scale model (maquette) or a rapid, disposable sketch of a final design.
Definition: Prototyping is building a small, safe-to-fail model. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in building a small, safe-to-fail model of a new social process.

concepts.name: Rehearsal
concepts.theory_application: Practice a performance or procedure in advance to ensure readiness and identify issues.

variations.theory: Definition: Rehearsal is practicing a complex procedure. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in practicing a complex lab procedure to ensure accuracy and reduce error rates before the final experiment.
Definition: Rehearsal is a 'dry run' of the demo. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in a 'dry run' of the product demo or pitch to prepare for the Sprint Review.
Definition: Rehearsal is practicing the delivery of a defense. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in practicing the delivery of a conference paper or thesis defense in front of peers.

Definition: Rehearsal is the dedicated practice of a performance piece. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the dedicated, iterative practice of a performance piece to achieve technical accuracy and expressive depth. (N30)
Definition: Rehearsal is practicing a dialogue protocol. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in practicing a community dialogue protocol or a social intervention in a safe setting.

concepts.name: Service
concepts.theory_application: Perform actions with the primary intention of benefiting others or a larger cause.

variations.theory: Definition: Service is performing the action to serve the greater goal. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the action is performed to serve the greater scientific goal or the needs of the funding body/public.
Definition: Service is performing the work to serve the customer. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the core belief that the work is performed to serve the customer by solving a real problem.
Definition: Service is scholarly work framed as a public service. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the scholarly work is framed as a service to public discourse or the communities of study.
Definition: Service is the art piece created as a service to its mission. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the art piece is created as a service to its cultural mission or patron's intent.

Definition: Service is the core value that all work is performed as an act of service. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the core value that all work is performed as an act of service to the community and environment.

concepts.name: Storywork
concepts.theory_application: Use narrative structures to organize information, communicate meaning, and engage others.

variations.theory: Definition: Storywork is framing the process as a narrative. Procedural Link: The action is to frame the process of execution as a linear narrative or a procedural story.
Definition: Storywork is using narrative in status updates. Procedural Link: The action is to use narrative techniques in stand-ups or status updates to contextualize the work for the team.

Definition: Storywork is enacting knowledge through cultural stories. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the indigenous practice of enacting knowledge through the telling and embodiment of cultural stories.
Definition: Storywork is the performative act of telling the story. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the performative act of telling the story of the work's creation.

Definition: Storywork is the ceremonial practice of working with stories. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in the ceremonial practice of working with stories to renew relationships and transmit integrated knowledge.

concepts.name: Tinkering
concepts.theory_application: Engage in unstructured, playful experimentation with materials or systems to discover new possibilities.

variations.theory: Definition: Tinkering is unstructured, exploratory interaction. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in unstructured, exploratory interaction with materials or tools to discover new effects or solutions not covered by the plan.

Definition: Tinkering is exploratory coding. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in unstructured, exploratory coding or experimentation with technical solutions outside of the main plan (e.g., a 'hackathon').

Definition: Tinkering is playful, non-goal-oriented engagement. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in playful, non-goal-oriented engagement with sources that may lead to unexpected interpretive breakthroughs.
Definition: Tinkering is playful, unstructured creation. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in playful, unstructured creation with materials that is often the source of novel ideas.
Definition: Tinkering is improvisational adaptation. Procedural Link: The action is to engage in improvisational adaptation of a protocol in response to an emergent social reality.

concepts.name: Virtue
concepts.theory_application: Cultivate and demonstrate moral excellence and character in action.

variations.theory: Definition: Virtue is the consistent practice of professional excellence. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the consistent practice of professional excellence, diligence, and intellectual honesty in the execution of the protocol.
Definition: Virtue is the consistent practice of craftsmanship. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the consistent practice of craftsmanship, quality, and team collaboration during the sprint.

Definition: Virtue is the consistent practice of intellectual humility. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the consistent practice of intellectual humility and ethical conduct during fieldwork and drafting.

Definition: Virtue is the consistent practice of integrity to the material. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the consistent practice of integrity to the material and commitment to craft mastery.

Definition: Virtue is the conscious cultivation of moral character. Procedural Link: The action is to focus on the conscious cultivation of moral character (e.g., patience, courage, generosity) through daily action.

concepts.name: Friction
concepts.theory_application: Treat the feeling of difficulty or resistance not as a personal failure, but as a signal that the tool, process, or plan is misaligned with the reality of the work.

variations.theory: Definition: Friction is the resistance to motion. Procedural Link: The action is to measure the energy loss in the system and identify the specific point of contact causing the heat.
Definition: Friction is anything that prevents a user from achieving their goal. Procedural Link: The action is to identify the specific UI step where users drop off.
Definition: Resistance is a sign of a structural problem. Procedural Link: The action is to stop writing and check the outline; the friction usually means the argument is flawed.
Definition: Truth to Materials. Procedural Link: The action is to notice where the material resists the tool. Stop forcing it and change the angle of approach.
Definition: Friction is information about unmet needs. Procedural Link: The action is to treat interpersonal conflict as a signal that a boundary has been crossed.

concepts.name: Velocity
concepts.theory_application: Measure the rate of progress to predict completion and adjust scope, focusing on the direction of movement as much as the speed.

variations.theory: Definition: Kinetics measures how fast a reaction proceeds. Procedural Link: The action is to monitor the rate of data collection to ensure statistical significance is reached before funding runs out.
Definition: Velocity is the amount of work completed in a sprint. Procedural Link: The action is to calculate the average points completed to forecast future delivery dates.
Definition: Daily output tracks momentum. Procedural Link: The action is to track daily word count to maintain the habit of production, regardless of quality.
Definition: Tempo controls the energy of the performance. Procedural Link: The action is to regulate the speed of execution to ensure precision and expression.
Definition: Momentum is the visible energy of the movement. Procedural Link: The action is to track the rate of new sign-ups or donations to gauge the health of the campaign.
Earned Value Management (EVM). Procedural Link: Use CPI and SPI indices to mathematically forecast project completion.

concepts.name: Cognitive Load
concepts.theory_application: Manage the amount of working memory resources used, ensuring that the task difficulty does not exceed the practitioner's or user's capacity.

variations.theory: Definition: Cognitive Load Theory (Intrinsic, Extraneous, Germane). Procedural Link: The action is to remove extraneous load (bad UI) to free up capacity for germane load (learning).
Definition: Context switching destroys productivity. Procedural Link: The action is to batch similar tasks to reduce the 'switching cost' on the brain.
Definition: Readability scores estimate processing effort. Procedural Link: The action is to simplify sentence structure to ensure the reader has the energy to process the complex argument.
Definition: The brain seeks simple patterns. Procedural Link: The action is to group visual elements to reduce the number of individual units the eye must process.
Definition: Spoon Theory. Procedural Link: The action is to design the process so that people with limited energy (chronic illness, stress) can still participate.

concepts.name: Little's Law

variations.theory: WIP = Throughput * Cycle Time. Procedural Link: Reduce Work In Progress (WIP) to decrease Cycle Time.

concepts.theory_application: Use the mathematical relationship between WIP, Throughput, and Cycle Time to optimize flow.

concepts.name: Minimum Viable Product (MVP)

variations.theory: Definition: MVP is for learning, not scaling. Procedural Link: Build a 'Concierge' or 'Wizard of Oz' prototype to test value before building technology.

concepts.scenario: Testing a new food delivery service.
concepts.theory_application: Build the smallest version of the product that allows you to complete the 'Build-Measure-Learn' loop with minimum effort.
